intro: Pavetta breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes, and it produces small, fleshy berries as fruit. Pavetta breviflora is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
